meanings.definition: Of or relating to a viceroy or viceroyalty.
meanings.sent1: The viceregal palace was grand and majestic.
meanings.sent2: The viceregal duties included overseeing the colony.
meanings.sent3: The viceregal hat was so tall, it almost touched the ceiling!
meanings.sent4: Her presence at the event was viceregal, commanding attention from all.
meanings.sent5: The viceregal procession through the streets left a lasting impression on the townspeople.

meanings.definition: Acting or serving as a viceroy.
meanings.sent1: The viceregal representative handled diplomatic affairs with grace.
meanings.sent2: He was appointed as the viceregal governor of the province.
meanings.sent3: The viceregal chef prepared a feast fit for a king!
meanings.sent4: In her viceregal role, she made decisions that impacted the entire region.
meanings.sent5: The viceregal authority was evident in every decree issued by the ruler.
